combo box can be expanded using the Spacebar, Alt + Down Arrow, or Enter key. Once expanded, users can navigate through the options using the arrow keys. Multiple options or "Select All" can be chosen before applying the selection. Select Category Select Category Camps Culinary & Food Dance Festivals Film Free Gala History & Heritage Kids Lecture Literature Music -- Make Music Tallahassee 2025 Online/Streaming Theatre -- Stand-Up & Improv Visual Art Workshops & Classes -- Adult Classes -- Kids Classes -- Music Lessons -- Online Lessons Select Venue: Venue combo box can be expanded with either Spacebar, Alt + Down arrow key, or Enter. Then arrows can be used to explore the options. Only one selection can be made in each of these combo boxes. To select, navigate to the option with the arrow keys and then press enter to save the selection. Johnson By Tallahassee Arts Guide COCA Spotlight COCA Spotlight: Marjorie Grussin By Tallahassee Arts Guide View All Stories OUR PARTNERS COCA's programs are sponsored in part by the City of Tallahassee, Leon County, the State of Florida, Department of State, Division of Cultural Affairs, Community Foundation of North Florida, Knight Foundation, National Endowment for the Arts, and the Tallahassee Community Redevelopment Agency. COCA, the Council on Culture & Arts, is a non-profit organization that serves as the facilitator and voice for the arts and cultural industry in Florida's capital area. COCA provides information and promotes the arts and culture to both citizens and visitors. ABOUT US DIRECTORIES CLASSIFIEDS PARTNERS CONTACT US 114 S DUVAL STREET TALLAHASSEE, FL 32301 LOCAL NUMBER: (850) 224-2500 EMAIL: info@tallahasseearts.org © Copyright 2025 - Council on Culture & Arts | Contact Us | Site Map | Privacy Policy Powered by ARTSOPOLIS The COCA office currently has adjusted office hours to 1 PM – 5 PM to accommodate pickup for Winterfest. These hours will be adjusted from Tuesday, February 11, through Friday, February 28 . Regular office hours will return on Monday, March 3. For questions, feel free to contact staff via phone or email. In addition, access to Railroad Avenue between Gaines Street & FAMU Way is down to one lane heading south. For access to the COCA office, please take Gaines Street as currently, the COCA office is not accessible off of FAMU Way.

State Cafeteria Event Calendar Academic Calendar Clubs and Organizations Gadsden State Athletics Fine Arts On-Campus Housing Social Media Directory Search Apply Apply MyGadsdenstate Menu Faculty and Staff Resources Home Students Current Students Teaching and Learning Center Faculty and Staff Resources Meeting the Needs of Faculty and Staff The Teaching and Learning Center promotes teaching excellence by : Facilitating the sharing of the pedagogical knowledge available in research on teaching and learning Providing resources that lead to understanding and use of documented best practices in teaching and learning Offering programs and resources that engage faculty in reflections and discussions that encourage purposeful, informed pedagogy Providing faculty with the technology and training that they need to keep their instruction on the cutting edge Technology-based Resources Blackboard Learn – Allows instructors to provide content to students in a central location, communicate with them quickly and provide grades electronically Respondus LockDown Browser – Customized browser that increases the security of test delivery in Blackboard Respondus Monitor – Protects the integrity of non-proctored, online exams. Students use their own computer and a webcam to record assessment sessions that allows faculty to review the full color video to ensure the integrity of the exam was not compromised. Respondus 4.0 Test Generator – Tool for creating and managing exams that can be printed to paper or published directly to Blackboard. Professional Development The TLC provides professional development opportunities for faculty and staff with an emphasis on effective teaching strategies, facilitative technologies, online learning and advancing the College’s mission of offering quality education and innovative workforce development. A wide variety of professional development in multiple formats are offered by a number departments throughout Gadsden State. For more specific information about TLC services for faculty and staff, go to myGadsdenState. Those having technical difficulties should contact the Help Desk for assistance. Meet the Team Dr. Derrick Griffey Director of Distance Education, Faculty Development and Learning Resources 256-439-6833 dgriffey@gadsdenstate.edu Hilary Blackwood Media Technician 256-549-8482 hblackwood@gadsdenstate.edu Students In This Section Students Future Students Transient Students Current Students Advising and Retention Center Cardinal Tutoring Center Final Exam Schedule Library Services Teaching and Learning Center International Students Why Gadsden State Important Information for International Students Bookstore Catalog College Calendar FAME Program Helpdesk Office of Disability Services and Resources DSR Handbook DSR Student Resources DSR Parent Resources DSR Faculty/Staff Resources DSR Policies/Procedures Student Ambassadors Testing Services TRiO Programs Veterans Upward Bound Valley Street Request Info Cardinal Career Explorer Request a Tour Accreditation Security ADA Compliance Complaint Process Operating Financial Data Employment Opportunities Facebook Instagram Instagram Instagram Flickr Ayers Campus 1801 Coleman Road Anniston, AL 36207 Directions Contact Info GADSDEN STATE Cherokee 801 Cedar Bluff Road Centre, AL 35960 Directions Contact Info East Broad Campus 424 East Cardinal Drive Gadsden, AL 35903 Directions Contact Info Valley STreet Campus 600 Valley Street Gadsden, AL 35901 Directions Contact Info WALLACE DRIVE CAMPUS 1001 George Wallace Drive Gadsden, AL 35903 Directions Contact Info © 2025 Gadsden State Community College Text-Only Version Accessibility Policy Site Map Web Design By: Third Wave Digital

Volunteer – Gadsden Arts Center & Museum 13 N Madison Street Quincy, FL 32351 | (850) 875-4866 Home About Mission-Vision Our History Board of Directors Meet Our Staff Employment Appraisals & Conservation GACM Magazine Gadsden Arts, Inc. 990 Events Events Art Trips Exhibitions Current Upcoming Art In Gadsden Artists Guild Exhibition Opportunities Education Youth & Family Children’s Groups Adults Creative Futures Council Collection Permanent Collection Vernacular Art Traveling Exhibitions Give Annual Giving Art For Children Impact Fund Legacy Giving & Endowment Corporate Sponsors Tributes Join Us Memberships Member Exclusives Volunteer Internships Visit Plan Your Visit Museum Shop Area Information Rentals Accessibility Thank You Volunteer Looking for a rewarding volunteer opportunity? The Gadsden Arts Center & Museum is successful due to the dedication of countless volunteers. Gadsden Arts has numerous volunteer opportunities available, depending on your interest. Below are just a few examples: Front desk greeter Gala decorating ArtZone Docent (tour guide) Opening receptions Data entry After-school programs Facility upkeep For volunteer opportunities, contact Grace Robinson at (850) 627-5020 . You can also download the New Volunteer Flyer here to complete a form about your interests and more information about volunteer tasks. Download Application Become an Art Guide! The Gadsden Arts Center & Museum’s Art Guide Program provides an educational opportunity for people of all backgrounds to learn and experience art and has been recognized in North Florida as an outstanding way of educating children and adults in Gadsden County and the region. Art Guides are trained volunteer educators interested in leading group tours to children, visitors, students, and the local community through Gadsden Arts’ exhibitions. No prior experience or knowledge is required; just a desire to learn and share. For more information contact Kaiyla Thompson at (850) 627-5023 Stay In Touch Facebook Instagram YouTube Flickr Support The Gadsden Arts Center & Museum was accredited by the American Alliance of Museums in 2016. We are the only independent accredited art museum in the Big Bend Region. Copyright © 2024, Gadsden Arts Center & Museum All images of artwork are the sole property of the artist or the Gadsden Arts Center & Museum and may not be reproduced or distributed without written permission. understanding and appreciation of the visual arts to improve the quality of life in Gadsden County and the region. The organization works to enhance arts education, provide cultural opportunities, and stimulate economic growth in the community. Legacy & Endowment – Gadsden Arts Center & Museum 13 N Madison Street Quincy, FL 32351 | (850) 875-4866 Home About Mission-Vision Our History Board of Directors Meet Our Staff Employment Appraisals & Conservation GACM Magazine Gadsden Arts, Inc. 990 Events Events Art Trips Exhibitions Current Upcoming Art In Gadsden Artists Guild Exhibition Opportunities Education Youth & Family Children’s Groups Adults Creative Futures Council Collection Permanent Collection Vernacular Art Traveling Exhibitions Give Annual Giving Art For Children Impact Fund Legacy Giving & Endowment Corporate Sponsors Tributes Join Us Memberships Member Exclusives Volunteer Internships Visit Plan Your Visit Museum Shop Area Information Rentals Accessibility Thank You Legacy Giving & Endowment Gadsden Arts Legacy Society A well-planned gift communicates your legacy and tells the story of what you hold as most important in your life and community. Planned giving is a way of making a valuable contribution to the museum. By including Gadsden Arts in your estate planning, your gift has a long-lasting impact on the museum and the community we serve. The Gadsden Arts Legacy Society honors individuals who have made a commitment to the future of Gadsden Arts by including the museum in their estate plans. Gadsden Arts Legacy Society Members Park Adams Patsy and Mark Bates Carole D. Fiore Leigh Watson Healy and John Healy Jane and Alex Hinson Luis Maza** Patricia Yancey Martin Jim Miller Neil Mooney Dana Preu** Meredith and Robert DeWitt Smith Margaret and Randolph Thrower* Grace Robinson Katee Tully Marjorie Turnbull Watson Arts Fund Elaine Tully Woodward** and Bob Woodward** Julia Munroe Woodward** Katherine Woodward Jenny and Mayo Woodward ** Deceased Gadsden Arts Endowment Trust Value as of January, 2024 $1.2M / Goal $2M Gadsden Arts is a vitally important community resource – enriching life for everyone and contributing to the cultural and economic vitality of our community. You can help sustain Gadsden Arts in perpetuity through the Gadsden Arts Endowment Trust. The Trust supports Gadsden Arts programs and facility needs. Principal is permanently restricted to ensure longevity, and a conservative 2.5% spending rate promotes fund growth over time. Contributions of any amount may be made to the endowment, with cumulative giving of $50,000+ recognized through a fund named for you, your family, or a loved one. A fund of $100,000 can designate support for a specific area of programming. Contact Grace Robinson to explore your possible investment in endowment, (850) 627-5020. Gadsden Arts Endowment Trust Named Funds Margaret and Randolph Thrower Fund for Collections Julia Munroe Woodward Endowment Fund Elaine and Bob Woodward Endowment Fund Mary Jane and Pat Woodward Endowment Fund Planned Giving Options Bequests A bequest is a provision in one’s last will and testament directing a transfer from your estate to a charitable organization. It is one of the simplest and most powerful ways to support the charities you care about for generations to come. Sample language for a direct bequest: I give $_____________ (or X% of my estate) to the Gadsden Arts Center & Museum, a nonprofit corporation as described in section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code, located at 13 North Madison Street, Quincy, FL 32351, to be used for its tax-exempt purposes. You can create a wonderful legacy next time you update your will. Publicly Traded Stock Shares of appreciated publicly traded securities are an effective way to support Gadsden Arts and avoid taxation on the gain. We can receive stock gifts directly through your brokerage account; you receive a charitable income tax deduction, usually equivalent to fair market value calculated as the average of the high and low stock price on the day the stock is received by Gadsden Arts. We will sell the stock immediately and apply the net proceeds toward our mission. To transfer stock to Gadsden Arts, call (850) 627-5020 for our DTC and broker information. Life Insurance Life insurance is a simple way to make a significant gift. Donors designate Gadsden Arts as the owner and beneficiary of the policy using, for example, an existing paid-up life insurance policy, an existing policy on which you are still making payments, or a new policy that you purchase. Retirement Accounts Naming Gadsden Arts as a primary or contingent beneficiary on a retirement account is an easy way to make a planned gift to the museum. A simple beneficiary designation form or online designation is usually all it takes to include the museum in your estate plans. Artwork Potential donations of art require special advance planning. Please contact Ashley Williams, Curator, for more information about the museum’s Collection Policy. Contact: Grace Robinson, Executive Director at (850)-627-5020 Stay In Touch Facebook Instagram YouTube Flickr Support The Gadsden Arts Center & Museum was accredited by the American Alliance of Museums in 2016. We are the only independent accredited art museum in the Big Bend Region. About the Hardin Center – Gadsden Cultural Arts Foundation info@culturalarts.org (256) 543-2787 Donate Now / Payments Membership Exhibits Imagination Place About Imagination Place Birthday Parties Field Trips and Outreach Programs Etowah Youth Orchestras About EYO EYO Online Payments Audition Concerts & Strings Ensembles Funds for Access Scholarship Info The Music Center at Temple Beth Israel School for the Arts GCSA Class Schedule  / Info GCSA Online Payments Funds for Access Scholarship Info Gadsden Youth Chorus Dance Conservatory About DDC Audition Information DDC Schedule Gadsden Symphony Orchestra About Hours / Admission / Staff Contact Us Take a Virtual Tour Online Donations About the Foundation Membership Planned Giving About the Hardin Center The Cultural Arts Foundation is a positive reflection of the best interests of our city. About Us The Gadsden Cultural Arts Foundation was founded in May 1984, in order to provide, maintain and operate a cultural arts facility for the citizens of the City of Gadsden, Etowah County and their surrounding communities. It was chartered in response to citizen initiatives, as an independent, non profit organization. The Cultural Arts Foundation is a positive reflection of the best interests of our city. Our Mission: The Gadsden Cultural Arts Foundation serves as a hub of community arts. Our Vision: We enrich our lives, support artistic and cultural progress, affirm individual value and dignity, and promote a sense of well-being for all people. The Projects of the Gadsden Cultural Arts Foundation are made possible through major support of the City of Gadsden and the Alabama State Council on the Arts. Hours of Operation *** Imagination Place will be closed for maintenance on Friday, September 19 and Saturday, September 20. *** Monday – Thursday & Saturday: 10 am – 1 pm & 2 pm – 5 pm Friday: 10 am to 1 pm Sunday: Closed The last visitors are admitted 1 hour before closing time. By entering the facility, all visitors grant the Gadsden Cultural Arts Foundation, Inc. the right, but not the obligation, to photograph and film their likeness, as well as that of their minor children, for promotional purposes in any and all media now known or hereafter devised in perpetuity throughout the world. Announcement Board We hope you'll visit soon! *** Imagination Place will be closed for maintenance on Friday, September 19 and Saturday, September 20. *** Admission • Admission to view the art exhibitions and the model railroad is free. Admission for Imagination Place Children’s Museum is $8 for all-day access. Children up to 24 months are free. Free for Members* • Parents with a valid EBT card receive admission for up to 6 people (adults and children) for $2 per person. • The Hardin Center does not offer senior, student, or military discounts. The Hardin Center reciprocates through the ASTC Passport Program. Free admission is granted to Imagination Place Children’s Museum and discounts are usually offered for other exhibitions. Some restrictions and exclusions apply; please call ahead to inquire about current discounts. Find Us Location 501 Broad Street Gadsden, AL 3590 (256) 543-2787 Our entrance and parking are located in the rear of the facility accessible from 5th Street. Join us in this exciting initiative where we will work with art lovers to create a successful and enriching experience. Registration minimum: 5 participants, maximum: 16 participants Participants must bring their own materials; a materials list will be sent at least two weeks in advance of each workshop Want to host your own Artist Workshop? Gadsden Arts is inviting artists to lead workshops in our Woodell Family Studio. The Gadsden Arts Center & Museum Artist Workshops are designed to offer an opportunity for regional artists to engage and inspire the Big Bend region. Share your expertise, inspire others, and become a part of our vibrant art community by filling out the form below. Please print the form, mail it to Gadsden Arts 13 N. Madison St., Quincy, FL 32351, or scan it and send it to kaiyla.thompson@gadsdenarts.org . Please also email images of the proposed project to be used for marketing purposes. Proposal Form Adults: Plan Your Playtime! Who says Field Trips are just for kids? Bring your friends and family for a Grown-Up Field Trip at Gadsden Arts! Groups of 4+ will enjoy a fun and inspiring conversation about art on view and learn something new! Request an exhibition-inspired art activity as part of your art experience! Bring your own snacks and drinks, or order in lunch, and after your guided visit, relax with your group in our Bates Community Room – great for book clubs, touring groups, or family outings. FREE with the price of admission. Reservations required, contact (850) 627-5023. Admission waivers available for groups for which admission would be a barrier to attendance. Tour Admission Waiver Open Studio Every Wednesday, 2pm–5pm Become a Gadsden Arts member to use our 2nd floor Woodell Family Art Studio for our weekly Open Studio. Paint with your peers in a self-directed, open-ended studio environment. Bringing your own supplies and projects is recommended. Limited classroom supplies available. Elizabeth Catlett – Gadsden Arts Center & Museum 13 N Madison Street Quincy, FL 32351 | (850) 875-4866 Home About Mission-Vision Our History Board of Directors Meet Our Staff Employment Appraisals & Conservation GACM Magazine Gadsden Arts, Inc. 990 Events Events Art Trips Exhibitions Current Upcoming Art In Gadsden Artists Guild Exhibition Opportunities Education Youth & Family Children’s Groups Adults Creative Futures Council Collection Permanent Collection Vernacular Art Traveling Exhibitions Give Annual Giving Art For Children Impact Fund Legacy Giving & Endowment Corporate Sponsors Tributes Join Us Memberships Member Exclusives Volunteer Internships Visit Plan Your Visit Museum Shop Area Information Rentals Accessibility Thank You Elizabeth catlett The Art of Elizabeth Catlett: From the Samella Lewis Collection February 17, 2023 – April 15, 2023 Sara May Love Gallery Sculptor and printmaker Elizabeth Catlett is widely considered one of the most important Black artists of the 20th century. Her work blended art and social consciousness and confronted injustices against African Americans. Catlett became one of the first three students to receive an MFA at the University of Iowa in 1940, and the first African American woman. She is best known for her sculptures and prints created during the 1960s and 70s. This collection comes from scholar Samella Lewis, who lived and worked in Tallahassee early in her career. Lewis and Catlett were lifelong friends, and Lewis went on to write African American Art History to recapture artists and work that had been marginalized by art historians of the time. Both women pioneered professional opportunities for Black female artists in the visual arts. This collection features 30 works by Elizabeth Catlett including lithographs, mixed media, woodcuts, bronze, and wood sculptures; a few works by her husband, Francisco Mora; and works by Lewis herself. This exhibition was organized by Landau Traveling Exhibitions, Los Angeles, CA. Field Trips Be sure to check out our Elizabeth Catlett-themed Field Trips for all ages, ArtZone activities, and Art @ Home Kits during the exhibition, offering art-filled fun for all ages! Contact Museum Educator, Sarah Black-Sadler at (850) 627-5023 or sarah.blacksadler@gadsdenarts.org to schedule a tour. Art Talk Live! Thursday, April 6, 2023, 5:30 pm—6:30 pm on Zoom (FREE) Join staff from the National Museum of Women in the Arts (NMWA) and the Gadsden Arts Center & Museum (GACM) to explore connections between GACM’s exhibition The Art of Elizabeth Catlett: From the Collection of Samella Lewis and NMWA’s collection. This exhibition comes from the collection of Dr. Samella Lewis (1924-2022), a student of Catlett and an accomplished artist, professor, and author, and features 30 works by Elizabeth; a few works by her husband, Francisco Mora; and works by Lewis herself. The conversation will extend to artists with ties to Catlett’s past and present, such as Loïs Mailou Jones, one of Catlett’s teachers at Howard University. The National Museum of Women in the Arts ( NMWA ) is the first museum in the world solely dedicated to championing women through the arts. With its collections, exhibitions, programs, and online content, the museum inspires dynamic exchanges about art and ideas. NMWA advocates for better representation of women artists and serves as a vital center for thought leadership, community engagement, and social change. NMWA addresses the gender imbalance in the presentation of art by bringing to light important women artists of the past while promoting great women artists working today. The collections highlight paintings, sculptures, photography, and video by artists including Louise Bourgeois, Mary Cassatt, Judy Chicago, Frida Kahlo, Shirin Neshat, Faith Ringgold, Pipilotti Rist, Amy Sherald, and Élisabeth Louise Vigée-LeBrun.
